decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing the Greasefang Parhelion combo to generate powerful board presence and overwhelm opponents. The deck includes cards to support the combo, protect key pieces, and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The main goal is to assemble the Parhelion II and Greasefang, Okiba Boss combination to create a strong board state that is difficult for opponents to deal with efficiently. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and disruption like Thoughseize to control the pace of the game and prevent opponents from stopping the combo.

The main focus of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly and efficiently play low-cost creatures and spells to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. By using card draw and burn spells like Fiery Impulse and Torch the Tower, the deck aims to maintain a fast pace and pressure the opponent to disrupt their game plan. The inclusion of cards like Treasure Cruise and Sleight of Hand also helps in maintaining card advantage and finding key pieces needed to push for the win. The strategy revolves around aggressive plays and fast tempo to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on assembling and protecting the combo pieces of Greasefang and Parhelion II, utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Fleeting Spirit and Seasoned Hallowblade provide evasive threats to pressure the opponent while Monument to Endurance and Sheltered by Ghosts help protect the key combo pieces. The deck also includes utility lands like Geier Reach Sanitarium and The Mycosynth Gardens to support the overall game plan. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and win the game before the opponent can respond effectively.

This aggressive deck focuses on dealing damage quickly and efficiently, utilizing a mix of direct damage spells, creatures with haste, and cards that can pump up your creatures' power. The strategy is to establish a strong board presence early on, while utilizing direct damage spells to finish off the opponent's life total. With a mix of burn spells, aggressive creatures, and powerful enchantment, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with instants and sorceries to bring back Arclight Phoenix and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. It utilizes cheap spells like Opt, Consider, and Fiery Impulse to trigger the Phoenix's ability while also providing card advantage through Treasure Cruise. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Spell Pierce and Brazen Borrower to control the tempo of the game. Ultimately, the goal is to maintain pressure on the opponent and close out the game before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on assembling the Greasefang Parhelion combo, utilizing cards like Godless Shrine, Greasefang Okiba Boss, and Parhelion II to overwhelm the opponent. Thoughtseize helps disrupt the opponent's strategy while Seasoned Hallowblade and Sheltered by Ghosts provide protection. Monument to Endurance and The Mycosynth Gardens offer support for the combo pieces, allowing for a fast and consistent win condition. The inclusion of Fleeting Spirit and Fatal Push helps control the board and ensure the combo can be executed smoothly.

This deck focuses on assembling the combo of Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II to generate a powerful advantage over your opponent. It includes cards that support this combo such as Guardian of New Benalia and Monument to Endurance. The deck also includes cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control and disrupt your opponent's game plan. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm your opponent with a powerful board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to maintain a fast-paced aggressive strategy by using cards that disrupt the opponent's hand and board while also applying pressure with efficient creatures and removal spells. The deck utilizes a mix of hand disruption like Thoughtseize and Duress, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to control the game tempo. Additionally, powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger are included to provide a strong late-game presence and close out the match quickly.

This deck is focused on quickly bringing out Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard and dealing damage to the opponent. With cards like Sleight of Hand, Opt, and Consider to help dig for Phoenix and draw more cards, along with spells like Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe for removal and damage, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. The inclusion of Treasure Cruise helps refill the hand after casting multiple spells in a turn. Picklock Prankster and Artist's Talent provide additional ways to trigger Arclight Phoenix's ability and keep the pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo of Greasefang and Parhelion II to take control of the game. It includes cards like Fleeting Spirit and Monument to Endurance to protect the combo pieces and ensure they can stay on the battlefield. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, as well as card advantage with Geier Reach Sanitarium and Lively Dirge. By utilizing the synergy between these cards, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through its powerful combo.

The deck focuses on utilizing the synergy between Greasefang and Parhelion II to create a powerful combo that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Overlord of the Balemurk help to support this combo, while cards like Duress and Thoughtseize disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes various removal spells like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse to deal with threats on the opponent's side of the board. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to assemble the Greasefang Parhelion combo while controlling the game with disruption and removal spells.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is centered around utilizing a combination of hand disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize, removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat, and powerful creatures like Graveyard Trespasser and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil for added control elements. The goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent through a combination of disruption, removal, and threat presence.

The main focus of this Red Deck Wins pioneer archetype is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent through aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. With a low mana curve and efficient cards, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own game plan. Key cards such as Robber of the Rich, Kumano Faces Kakkazan, and Reckless Rage help maintain board control and deal consistent damage. The inclusion of Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance adds an extra source of damage and value to close out games.

The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures while utilizing burn spells to control the board. The deck aims to consistently deal damage to the opponent early on, utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger to chip away at their life total. Reckless Rage and Burst Lightning provide removal options to clear the way for your creatures to attack. The deck also includes cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Kumano Faces Kakkazan to synergize with the burn spells and further pressure the opponent. With a mix of creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to be a relentless and efficient aggro deck.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to utilize a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage to control the game and outvalue the opponent. With cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils providing card advantage and disruption, along with powerful finishers like Elspeth, Storm Slayer and The Wandering Emperor to close out the game, this deck aims to outlast the opponent and control the board until it can establish a dominant position and secure the victory.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with low-cost and efficient creatures, supported by burn spells and combat tricks to maintain pressure. The deck's key strategy is to aggressively attack and deal damage to the opponent's life total, using cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage to maximize the damage output. The deck also includes resilient threats like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Emberheart Challenger to sustain pressure even if the opponent manages to stabilize. Overall, the deck aims to win the game quickly through consistent aggression and efficient creature-based damage.
